context_bundle.summary: UI testing best practices include Page Object pattern for maintainability, explicit waits for stability, data-testid attributes for reliable selectors, test isolation, and testing pyramid (more unit, fewer E2E) for efficient coverage.

onboarding.quick_start: UI testing strategy: 1) Use testing pyramid (70% unit, 20% integration, 10% E2E). 2) Implement Page Object pattern for DRY tests. 3) Use data-testid for stable selectors. 4) Isolate tests (independent, no shared state). 5) Use explicit waits for dynamic content. 6) Run tests in parallel. 7) Capture screenshots/videos on failure. Focus E2E tests on critical user flows.
common_patterns: Testing pyramid: 70% unit tests (fast, isolated, components), 20% integration tests (API, service layer), 10% E2E tests (critical user flows only)

Page Object: class LoginPage { constructor(page) { this.page = page; this.emailInput = '#email'; this.passwordInput = '#password'; this.submitButton = '#submit' } async login(email, password) { await this.page.fill(this.emailInput, email); await this.page.fill(this.passwordInput, password); await this.page.click(this.submitButton) } }
Stable selectors: Use data-testid: <button data-testid='submit-btn'>Submit</button>; // Test: cy.get('[data-testid="submit-btn"]').click(); // Avoid: cy.get('.btn.btn-primary.mt-3').click() (fragile)
Test isolation: beforeEach(() => { // Reset state cy.clearCookies(); cy.clearLocalStorage(); // Seed test data cy.request('POST', '/api/test/reset'); cy.request('POST', '/api/test/seed', testData) })
Parallel execution: // Cypress: cypress run --parallel --record --key=<key>; // Playwright: pytest -n auto --dist loadgroup
